title: saxydev
author: saxydev
created_time: August 25, 2022, 09:22:13 PMLast edit: August 25, 2022, 09:35:17 PM by saxydev
content: Interested in finding the real owner of a btc address - 40$ XMRneed some research, google won't help muchmore than 1000 btc traded on itaddress sent by PM.Please don't make it public, sensitive matter (not personal).local rule: no signature spam posts

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: Fivestar4everMVP on August 25, 2022, 10:58:03 PMMy Advice is,  maybe you should try to find out the centralized  exchange the address traded bitcoins on,  maybe the owner of the address have KYCed on that exchange,  so they are the ones in the best place to provide you with the information you seek,  but mind you,  you must give them the reason why you want the information of that user,  and your reason must be of utmost importance and highly genuine enough,  if not,  you won't be given any attention.No matter how good the reason is, there's a very good chance they'll give out such info only under a warrant.However, if the address is not posted in a forum or part of exchange, a good direction can be to look at chain analysis websites and see if it's linked to an address that can be tracked. But such info is most probably also not for free (that's why I will not do the research; I hope it's a helpful idea though).PS. I tried to help; if you feel like removing the post, feel free.

comments.author: saxydev
comments.body: Quote from: NeuroticFish on August 26, 2022, 06:23:20 AMQuote from: Fivestar4everMVP on August 25, 2022, 10:58:03 PMMy Advice is,  maybe you should try to find out the centralized  exchange the address traded bitcoins on,  maybe the owner of the address have KYCed on that exchange,  so they are the ones in the best place to provide you with the information you seek,  but mind you,  you must give them the reason why you want the information of that user,  and your reason must be of utmost importance and highly genuine enough,  if not,  you won't be given any attention.No matter how good the reason is, there's a very good chance they'll give out such info only under a warrant.However, if the address is not posted in a forum or part of exchange, a good direction can be to look at chain analysis websites and see if it's linked to an address that can be tracked. But such info is most probably also not for free (that's why I will not do the research; I hope it's a helpful idea though).PS. I tried to help; if you feel like removing the post, feel free.Really weird that chain analysis doesn't have information about it actually, for me it is somehow good. If you just try to google the address you will understand at the least about what is this about in my AML work. The owner/the organisation using the address don't deserve any more publicity of having their address posted no where here or in public ever.The post was deleted because it given no information and it was vague just for the sake of posting.

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: saxydev on August 26, 2022, 06:49:20 AMReally weird that chain analysis doesn't have information about it actually, Keep in mind that there's probably a huge difference between what chain analysis shows freely/publicly and what can they do as paid service. It was often said that the free service is more a honeypot than something useful.

Got only in my job offerings 1 person workin ~10 minutes (he cried 5 days about it) he got 10$ in xmr after i told him i pay minimum 20$, even if the job was really high paid.. I mean 20$ he could in 5 minutes just doing random research.Only 1 PM in almost 24 hours, nobody even interested in easy money.

comments.body: I do not agree with the decision of the moderators to move the topic to marketplace of altcoins just because I am offering to pay in XMR, way less views in this subsection of the forum and I decided to lock the topic!
